info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 9:30PM CDT until August 12 at 12:10PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...
Cedar Creek At Cedarburg affecting Ozaukee County.
Fox River Lower At Waukesha affecting Waukesha County.
Milwaukee River Near Cedarburg affecting Ozaukee County.
Root River At Franklin affecting Milwaukee County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...
Menomonee River At Menomonee Falls affecting Waukesha County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Root River at Franklin.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Portions of the Root River Parkway are flooded. A portion of Oakwood Road in southern Milwaukee County is flooded and closed. Some yards along the river are flooded. There is flooding to agricultural land.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Monday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 2.4 feet Monday, August 18. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 930 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
